intro: Dissochaeta tawaensis, commonly known as the Tawa sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and succulent leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with thick, fleshy stems that store water. Dissochaeta tawaensis is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun.
